name: tap water production, conventional treatment | tap water | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19424/documentation

This dataset represents production of 1 kg of tap water under pressure at facility gate, ready for distribution in network. It represents average operation of conventional treatment for production tap water. Conventional treatment includes coagulation, flocculation and decantation. In some occasions the treatment also includes, chemical application, filtration, pH stabilization and/or softening, which can be present in some plants. Inventory was constructed from reported chemicals, energy inputs and wastes from Rand Water treatment plant, one of the biggest water boards responsible for local water provision and quality in South Africa.

This activity starts from tap water, under pressure, at tap water treatment plant and fed into tap water distribution network.

This dataset ends with the production of tap water, at facility gate, under pressure. It includes energy for intake pumping and treatment system, as well as the energy of the pump pressurizing water to the beginning of the network. It includes all chemicals and material added to the water during treatment. It excludes energy for pumping stations and water losses within the network as they are included in the tap water market. Emissions to the environment occurring during the treatment and during the distribution were not considered as they are assumed negligible. Main substance in water that would be released in the environment are assumed to be considered in wastewater processes.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is set from 2012  to the year 2017 as it is  aconsidering period in which conventional treatment data has not passed through drastic changes.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Extrapolated data from Rand Water conventional treatment plant in South Africa ( one of the biggest water boards in the country), which accounts for 32% of the total produced tap water in South Africa. The uncertainty was adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Most Frequent technology in tap water production facility in South Africa
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From 1 conventional water board  tap water production facilities in South Africa to all conventional facility in the country. Conventional treatment accounts for 86.6% of the total produced tap water in South Africa (assumed that all the surface water is treated with conventional treatment technology). Data was used for regionalizing chemicals and energy exchanges, the remianing exchanges were copied from the global dataset.The uncertainty has been changed accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on data from Rand Water, one of the biggest water board responsible for local water provision and quality, which accounts for  32% of the total produced tap water in South Africa. Conventional tap production facilities were regionalized in accordance to this company reported data ( Retrieved from http://www.waterwise.co.za/site/water/purification/story-tap-water.html)

exchanges.description: Calculated value. This mathematical relation was taken from the "tap water production, conventional treatment, GLO" dataset (accessed 20170920) as it was considered adequate also for this dataset. Amount of water works construction attributed to the production of 1kg of tap water. Value is based on assumed lifetime production of water treatment plant and an assumed typical medium-sized plant of 30,000 m3/day.

exchanges.description: Measured value copied from "tap water production, conventional treatment, GLO" dataset (accessed 20170920) as it was considered adequate also for this dataset. Average electricity consumption for entire process including pumping for water intake and pumping for distribution at the plant gate. All 9 plant reported electricity use. Values reported varied from 7.32e-4 to 2.74e-4 kWh/kg.

exchanges.description: Calculated value taken from: " tap water production, conventional treatment, GLO" as it was also considered adequate. Amount of sand to compensate losses through sand filter washing. Extrapolated to all plant from one reported value. Also includes average use of micro-sand for adjustment for this technology. Note that only 1 of the 9 conventional plants reported using micro-sand. Plants not reporting this consumable were attributed an input value of 0 during the calculation of the weighted average.
